titleStmt.title: A true copy of the petition of the centlewomen, [sic] and tradesmens-wives in and about the city of London Delivered, to the Honourable, the knights, citizens, and burgesses, of the House of Commons in Parliament, the 4th. of February, 1641. Together, with the reasons why their sex ought thus to petition, as well as the men; and the manner how both their petition and reasons was delivered. Likewise the answer which the honourable assembly sent to them by Mr. Pym, as they stood at the House-doore. Whereunto is added the prophesie of old Sybilla.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Iohn Bull, dwelling in Grubstreet,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Guildhall Library, London.
